messages.subject: Dads at home
messages.msgSnippet: ... can t imaging it any more.  Not after I have experienced the difference in the depth of my connection to them.  In an ideal world I think both parents
messages.messageBody:
>But mostly I feel it is the fathers that miss out by working so much... I
can't imaging it any more.  Not after I have experienced the difference in
the depth of my connection to them.  In an ideal world I think both parents
should have the privledge of experiencing this closeness with their
children.<
 
I think that my children have learned so much this year by having Dad home. (DH was injured in an accident) With DH home, we have had more time to travel and not worry about time constraints. It also serves as a buffer when I need down time. I know that DH has loved the time he has spent with the children, and none of us looks forward to the day that he returns to the office. :( It is so great to have him here, and he has learned things about the children that I do not think he would if he were going to the office at 6:30am.
Stephanie


Ron and Stephanie
